Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2010 02:05PM mariek56 wrote: I recently had bilateral mastectomies and sentinel node biopsies and was told not to use deoterant because it affects lymph drainage.  I was introduced to an non-metallic deoterant called Alra which is sold at the Appearance Boutique located at Wake Forest University Baptist Medical Center in Winston-Salem, NC.  The deoterant does not contain aluminum and metallic salts.  It does contain Aloe Vera Gel, Oil of Cypress (which is a natural and fragrant astringent), and Lichen Extract ( which is  natural bactericide and fungicide).  It is recommended for those undergoing radiation.  It costs around $7.50 for 2.5oz.  I like it and it does work.
